title: Meg McEachran, PhD
text:
Leveraging data for evidence-based decision making
I specialize in transforming complex data into clear, actionable insights. With expertise in quantitative and statistical analysis, I help organizations make informed, evidence-based decisions that stand up to scrutiny.
From end-to-end analytical consulting to strategic decision support, I work with clients to develop robust solutions tailored to their needs. Whether it’s optimizing resource allocation, assessing risk, or building predictive models, I provide the evidence foundation needed for confident decision-making.
As an infectious disease subject matter expert with training in disease transmission mechanisms, disease ecology, and social-ecological systems, I bring deep domain knowledge to the table, helping public health agencies, research institutions, and businesses navigate complex challenges with data-backed strategies.
Let’s turn your data into decisions that matter.

title: About Me
text:
I’m an ecosystem health professional dedicated to leadership at the intersection of science and decision making. Got an disease, invasive species, wildlife or fisheries management problem? Let’s chat!
Current Position: Postdoctoral Associate in the DiRenzo Lab, University of Massachusetts Amherst and Massachusetts Cooperative Fish and Wildlife Research Unit
Visiting Scientist with the United States Geological Survey, Disease Decision Analysis and Research team
